DOC.brief_summary: The subclavian vein (SCV) is often the preferred site for central venous access. Ultrasound-guided SCV catheterizations with supraclavicular (SC) or infraclavicular (IC) approach have been proved to be useful in children. The investigators compared the success rate, number of attempts, time tocatheterization, and complication.
DOC.brief_title: Ultrasound-guided Subclavian Venous Catheterization in Children
DOC.criteria: central venous lines required patients children < 10 yr of age inadequate ultrasound visualization of the subclavian vein
